snippet: The average cost of a hard drive has risen to $66 from $51 after the flooding in Thailand closed factories late last year. The effects will continue to be felt into next year, says a technology research firm, I.H.S. iSuppli. Demand for the drives is...
abstract: The average cost of a hard drive has risen to $66 from $51 after the flooding in Thailand closed factories late last year. The effects will continue to be felt into next year, says a technology research firm, I.H.S. iSuppli. Demand for the drives is strong, it said, despite an economic slowdown in Europe, India and China.

headline.main: After Flooding Stops, Hard Drive Costs Continue to Rise
